Authors:
Beatriz Ortiz-Santana, Daniel L. Lindner, Otto Miettinen,
Alfredo Justo, David S. Hibbett
Title:
A phylogenetic overview of the antrodia clade (Basidiomycota,
Polyporales)
Abstract:
Phylogenetic relationships among members of the antrodia
clade were investigated using molecular data from two nuclear ribosomal
DNA regions, LSU and ITS. A total of 123 species representing 26 genera
producing a brown rot were included in the present study. Three DNA
datasets (combined LSU-ITS dataset, LSU dataset, ITS dataset) comprising
sequences of 449 isolates were evaluated using three different
phylogenetic analyses (Maximum Likelihood, Maximum Parsimony, Bayesian
inference). We present a phylogenetic overview of the five main groups
recovered: the fibroporia, laetiporus, postia, laricifomes and core
antrodia groups. Not all of the main groups received strong support in
the analyses, requiring further research. We were able to identify a
number of well-supported clades within the main groups.
